free_text.Required prior knowledge: Fluids mechanics, Hydrology for engineer, Hydraulic structures and schemes I
free_text.Content: [li][b] River training works[/b][br/]-	Objectives and historical examples[br/]-	Problems of channelization and impoverishment of morphology[br/]-	Interaction between sediment transport and river morphology[br/][li][b] Restoration of rivers[/b][br/]-	Classification of natural rivers[br/]-	Rivers as main interconnection of biotopes[br/]-	Assessment of ecological quality of rivers[br/]-	Constraints of river restoration[br/]-	Technical measures to mitigate the ecological deficits[br/]-	Restoration of rivers and flood protection - a contradiction ?[br/][br/][li][b] Dynamic behaviour of rivers[/b][br/]-	Unsteady flows and sediment transport[br/]-	Alluvial dynamics[br/]-	Disturbance of natural flow regime by hydraulic schemes: problem of minimum discharge, hydropeaking and river bed clogging colmatation[br/]-	Solutions to mitigate the harmful effects[br/][li][b] Bed forms and flow resistance[/b][br/]-	Dynamic bed forms[br/]-	Vertical and horizontal morphology[br/]-	Flow resistance of river bed and banks[br/][li][b] Natural morphological regimes[/b][br/]-	Regime channel (width, slope, depth)[br/]-	Meandering and draining[br/]-	Local widening[br/][li][b] Interaction between morphology and habitat quality for aquatic species[/b][br/]-	Ecology and fish habitat[br/]-	Habitat modelling[br/]-	Longitudinal and lateral connectivity; fish migration
free_text.Learning outcomes: Introduction to problematic of river training works and river restoration. [br/]Comprehension of interaction between morphology and ecology of rivers.[br/]Acquisition of basic knowledge for quantifying the morphological and dynamic behaviour of natural rivers.[br/][br/]

free_text.Remarque: LIAISON AVEC D'AUTRES COURS: Bio-ingénierie des cours d'eau et des systèmes naturels, Hydraulique fluviale et aménagements des cours d'eau
free_text.Prérequis: Mécanique des fluides, Hydrology for engineer, Ouvrages et aménagements hydrauliques I

free_text.Objectifs d'apprentissage: Introduction à la problématique des corrections et revitalisation des cours d'eau. Compréhension de l'interaction entre la morphologie et les fonctions écologiques d'un cours d'eau.Acquisition des connaissances de base nécessaires à la quantification des comportements morphologiques et dynamiques des cours d'eau naturels.
